thread.title: Strong finish vaults Langer
thread.title_full: Strong finish vaults Langer - San Antonio Express-News

author: John Whisler
title: Strong finish vaults Langer
text:
Photo: Marvin Pfeiffer, Staff / San Antonio Express-News Image 1 of / 1 Caption
Close
Image 1 of 1 Bernard Langer of Muchich, Germany tees off on the 17th hole during the final round of the San Antonio Championship on the AT&T Canyons Course at TRP San Antonio on Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015. Langer shot 12 under for the tournament to win by three strokes. MARVIN PFEIFFER/ mpfeiffer@express-news.net Bernard Langer of Muchich, Germany tees off on the 17th hole during the final round of the San Antonio Championship on the AT&T Canyons Course at TRP San Antonio on Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015. Langer shot 12 ... more Photo: Marvin Pfeiffer, Staff / San Antonio Express-News Strong finish vaults Langer 1 / 1 Back to Gallery He’d been here before, in 2012 and 2013 when he lost in frustrating fashion on the first hole of a playoff.
But Bernhard Langer made sure Sunday, birdieing three of the final four holes to win the San Antonio Championship by three strokes.
When he rolled in a 16-footer for birdie on 18 for the clincher, Langer punctuated his victory with a fist pump and wave to the gallery.
It was an uncharacteristic show emotion by the stoic German, once called “robo-player” by a colleague. But his 7-under 65 - the low round of the 54-hole tournament — on the 6,923-yard AT&T Canyons Course was vintage Langer.
“I was pushed today,” he said. “A bunch of players got off to a good start. It was a matter of who was going to close the best.”
For more, visit ExpressNews.com
